[[File:Female Syrian Protester in front of the Syria Embassy in Cairo.jpg|thumb|right|A female Syrian Protester in front of the Syria Embassy in Cairo in solidarity with the anti-regime protestors]]
*{{flag|Australia}} â On 25 March, Australian foreign minister [[Kevin Rudd]] said: "we are deeply sceptical about the official explanations as to what has happened with the various killings which have occurred in Daraa .... And we call directly on the Syrian Government to exercise restraint in their response to peaceful protest seeking democratic change."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/content/2011/s3174118.htm|title=Australia advises citizens not to travel to Syria|author=Alexandra kirk|date=25 March 2011|publisher=abc.net.au|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
*{{flag|Australia}} â On 25 March, Australian foreign minister [[Kevin Rudd]] said: "we are deeply sceptical about the official explanations as to what has happened with the various killings which have occurred in Daraa .... And we call directly on the Syrian Government to exercise restraint in their response to peaceful protest seeking democratic change."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/content/2011/s3174118.htm|title=Australia advises citizens not to travel to Syria|author=Alexandra kirk|date=25 March 2011|publisher=abc.net.au|accessdate=26 March 2011}}</ref>
*{{flag|Canada}} â On 21 March, Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] stated: "Canada deplores the multiple deaths and injuries following protests in several Syrian cities over the weekend."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jj7uSbIAaro1v0fwW4jziIxQ1j9w?docId=CNG.a807bd69f3debaa7a6b4ca2383f9500b.1191|title=Canada condemns violence in Yemen, Bahrain, Syria|publisher=AFP |date=21 March 2011|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> On 22 April, the Canadian Foreign Affairs minister advised all Canadians should avoid travelling to Syria, or those in Syria should leave. The government believed the situation "would only get worse before it got better".{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}}
*{{flag|Canada}} â On 21 March, Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] stated: "Canada deplores the multiple deaths and injuries following protests in several Syrian cities over the weekend."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jj7uSbIAaro1v0fwW4jziIxQ1j9w?docId=CNG.a807bd69f3debaa7a6b4ca2383f9500b.1191|title=Canada condemns violence in Yemen, Bahrain, Syria|publisher=AFP |date=21 March 2011|accessdate=22 March 2011}}</ref> On 22 April, the Canadian Foreign Affairs minister advised all Canadians should avoid travelling to Syria, or those in Syria should leave. The government believed the situation "would only get worse before it got better".{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}}
